meanings.sent1: After the event, they decided to remarket the products to reach more customers.
meanings.sent2: The company had to remarket their old stock to make room for new inventory.
meanings.sent3: Trying to remarket the same items felt like a fun challenge for the marketing team.
meanings.sent4: She had to remarket herself after changing careers, like a product with a new label.
meanings.sent5: The team brainstormed creative ways to remarket the products and boost sales.

meanings.sent1: The store had to remarket the items at a discount to clear out old stock.
meanings.sent2: He decided to remarket his old car after fixing it up a bit.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly said she would remarket her brother if she could make a profit.
meanings.sent4: The idea to remarket the vintage collection was like finding hidden treasure.
meanings.sent5: The decision to remarket the limited edition items caused a surge in demand.

meanings.sent1: The company needed to remarket the campaign to remind people of the upcoming event.
meanings.sent2: They had to remarket the new product launch to attract more attention.
meanings.sent3: He playfully suggested they should remarket the idea with a catchy jingle.
meanings.sent4: The team's effort to remarket the brand was like breathing new life into it.
meanings.sent5: The decision to remarket the charity event led to increased donations.
